content: socktober this pattern is designed to fit two sizes us 7-8 us 8-9 sizes uk 5-6 uk 6-7 eu 37-38 eu 38-39 yarn 4ply needles us 1 5 uk 13 eu 2 5 mm lana grossa meilenweit 2 sets of dpns 80 % virgin wool gauge 15 sts and 21 row for 2x2 inches/ 5x5 20% polyamide cm in stockinette/ stocking st 100 g =420 m/460 yards notions dpns stitch marker crochet needle color 1104 lot 33597 grey tapestry needle color 1323 lot 282892 red -1- abbreviations k1 tbl- knit 1 through the back loop co-cast on yo-yarn over k-knit sl-slip p-purl ssk-slip slip knit st-stitch rs- right side sts-stitches ws wrong side sl-slip mc- main color light green k2tg- knit 2 together cc contrast color dark green tbl-through the back loop kfb- knit front and back k2tbl- knit 2 through the back loop bor- beginning of the round sl1k- slip 1 knitwise mc- main color sl1p-slip 1 purwise cc-contrast color pattern because the cuff is constructed from three parts joined together it has less stretch and fits more snugly if you have a high instep consider using a larger needle size when working the cuff rolled cuff in mc co 64 + 1 st to join in the round long tail cast-on divide the sts onto four needles how to join in the round → https //youtu be/nwm6vpyfrv8 rounds 1-11 k all break off yarn rolled cuff in cc co 64 + 1 st to join in the round long tail cast-on divide the sts onto four needles rounds 1-13 k all don t cut the yarn place the red cuff into the grey one and k them tg in mc need more help → https //youtu be/75gcu7zcsiw frill using cc cast on 128 sts plus 1 st in to join in the round long tail cast-on divide the sts onto four needles break off yarn switch to mc round 1 k all round 2 * p2 k6* repeat round 3 * p2 k4 ssk* repeat round 4 * p2 k3 ssk * repeat round 5 * p2 k2 ssk * repeat round 6 * p2 k1 ssk * repeat you have 64 sts rounds 7-17 * p2 k2 * repeat -2- place the frill into the rolled cuff and k them tg in mc need more help → https //youtu be/aarremvixw8 knit two rounds in mc before starting the latvian braid latvian braid it should be firm but not tight round 1 *k1 cc k1 mc * repeat carry both yarns along the back round 2 hold both yarns to the front *p1 in cc p1 in mc * repeat always bring the old yarn to the right before purling the next st p 1 more st on the 1st needle in round 3 round 3 first st is already done p1 in cc continue with the second one * p1 in cc p1 in mc * repeat always bring the yarn to the opposite direction when purling
